entries: {@i Choose A or B:} (A) {@item Shield|XPHB}, {@item Mace|XPHB}, {@item Studded Leather Armor|XPHB}, {@item Explorer's Pack|XPHB}, and 10 GP; or (B) 80 GP

classFeature.name: Tough Resistance
entries: Being trained in the art of defense, many seemingly hurtful attacks are blocked by your use of shields and physical resistance. When you are hit by an attack, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to roll one of your Tough Resistance dice and add the result to your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} for that attack, potentially causing the attack to miss you. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. You regain any expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.
Your Tough Resistance die changes when you reach certain levels in this class, as shown in the Tough Resistance column of the Shielder table.

classFeature.name: Protective Focus
entries: Being centered in defense allows you to be more aware of the enemy's moves and react accordingly. While you are not wielding a weapon and are using a {@item Shield|XPHB}, your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} can instead be equal to your {@b Shielder DC} (8 + your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} + your Wisdom modifier) plus the AC bonus provided by that shield.

classFeature.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: Your training with shields allows you to use the mastery properties of all {@filter shields|items|type=shield=sand} and one {@filter simple weapon|items|type=simple weapon=sand} of your choice with which you have proficiency, such as Shortbows or Daggers.

Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can change the kind of weapon you chose. For example, you could switch to using the mastery properties from {@item Mace|XPHB} to {@item Handaxe|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Shield Adept
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you have got used to your shield as your offensive and defensive tool. You gain the following benefits while you are wearing a shield:

items: When you {@action Shove|XPHB} a creature with your shield, you can push them 10 feet instead of 5, or knock them {@condition Prone|XPHB} and reduce their speed to 0 until the start of your next turn.
If you aren't {@condition incapacitated|XPHB}, you can add your shield's AC bonus to any Dexterity saving throw you make against a spell or other harmful effect that targets only you.

classFeature.name: Shielder Subclass
entries: At 3rd level, you choose the way you want to manifest your desire for protecting others. Each path gives you powers to defend what you desire in different ways.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Mocking Taunt
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you learn to provoke enemies, unleashing insults and offenses, effectively manipulating them to attack you. As an {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, you may choose creatures up to your Proficiency bonus that are within 30 feet of you. As long as the target can hear you, each creature must succeed in a Wisdom saving throw against your {@b Shielder DC} or have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on all attack rolls against creatures other than you. When attacked by someone other than you or at the end of its turn, the creature can reroll the saving throw ending the effect on a success. This feature also ends early if you get the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (a minimum of 1). You regain all expended uses after you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Entrenched
entries: By 6th level, you learn to adopt a defensive stance where there aren't many who can break past it. When you finish your turn with remaining movement greater or equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, you enter a defensive stance. While in this stance, all attacks done against you have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}. Using your movement removes you from your defensive stance.
At 11th level, you may move up to 10 feet in your turn without losing your defensive stance, and at 17th level, you may move 20 feet. Using more movement removes you from your defensive stance.

classFeature.name: Shielder Subclass
entries: You gain a feature from your Shielder Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Coverage
entries: Beginning at 9th level, you can provide cover to allies near you. When a creature that is within 5 ft of you is attacked, you can impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the attack roll (no action required).

classFeature.name: Rally of Resistance
entries: Starting at 10th level, the clash of your shield with the enemy's weapons gives inner strength to your allies. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can choose a creature you can see within 60 feet of you other than yourself and give it one of your {@classFeature Tough Resistance|Shielder|DLA|1} dice. Once within the next 10 minutes, when the creature is attacked, it can use a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to roll the die and gain a bonus to AC for that attack equal to the result of the roll or add the result as a bonus to a saving throw of its choice. When an ally rolls a Tough Resistance die this way, they get {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the result.
Additionally, you recover all expended Tough Resistance die at the end of a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Defensive Study
entries: At 11th level, you learn to analyze a foe at any moment, especially in the heat of battle. If you spend at least 1 minute outside of battle {@action Study|PXHB|studying} a creature, or as your {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} in combat, you can discern certain strengths and weaknesses of a creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself; you know whether that creature has any {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|Immunities}, {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB|Resistances}, or {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB|Vulnerabilities}, and if the creature has any, you know what they are.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} and you may only use it once per creature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Grounded Bastion
entries: Beginning 13th level, you are able to protect yourself while standing your ground, being difficult to take down. You gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} against effects that push you or give you the {@condition Prone|XPHB} or {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition.
Additionally, when in your defensive stance you are immune to effects that push you, or give you the prone condition and have advantage in all Strength saving throws and contests.

classFeature.name: Body and Mind
entries: By 14th level, your mind has grown as strong as your body. When you have to roll for a Wisdom saving throw or use your Wisdom modifier, you can use your Constitution ability modifier instead and vice versa. If you are already proficient in the saving throw you are making, you can add your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus} twice. You also gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} against being {@condition Frightened|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Shielder Subclass
entries: You gain a feature from your Shielder Subclass.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify.

classFeature.name: Safe Aura
entries: At 17th level, your presence brings comfort to your allies. As an {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, choose up to 6 friendly creatures within 30 feet of you. For 1 minute, as long as they are within this range, they gain a +2 bonus to their {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB|AC} (as long as it does not surpass 18). You and the chosen creatures gain {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} against being {@condition Frightened|XPHB} as long as they remain in the area. You regain this feature after a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Adamantine Constitution
entries: By 18th level, you gain a constitution similar to that of adamantine. You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to all non-magical damage and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB}, to {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB|critical hits}.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. {@feat Boon of Recovery|XPHB} is recommended.

classFeature.name: Shielder Subclass
entries: You gain a feature from your Shielder Subclass.

subclass.name: Master of All Shields
subclassFeatures: Master of All Shields|Shielder|DLA|Master of All Shields|DLA|3

subclassFeature.name: Defender
entries: {@i Be the indestructible shield others need}

These shielders prefer to take protection issues into their own hands, often sacrificing themselves on the front line for others. They train their bodies to resist attacks that would vaporize others, and often use these abilities to protect their allies.

subclassFeature.name: Complete Protection
entries: When you decide the Defender Path at 3rd level, you learn to protect yourself more efficiently. When rolling a Dexterity saving throw you can use your Constitution ability modifier rather than your Dexterity.

Additionally if you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, or half damage if you fail, interposing your shield between yourself and the source of the effect.

subclassFeature.name: Careful Awareness
entries: Also at 3rd level, you are always careful to a certain measure, allowing you to be prepared for an ambush. At the start of combat, you gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB|resistance} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage and {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} in Dexterity saving throws until the start of your first turn.
At 18th level, you instead gain {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|immunity} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage and advantage to all saving throws until the start of your first turn.

subclassFeature.name: Guardian Angel
entries: By 7th level, you can move at incredible speeds to protect those who matter to you. When a friendly creature within an area equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is attacked, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to instantaneously move in front of them, and interpose your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB|AC} in the attack. If the attack roll is lower than your AC, you block the attack successfully. Otherwise, you take the hit instead of the creature. You can only use this feature once before a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
At 15th level, you may use it 2 times before resting. At 20th level, 3 times before a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Damage Absorption
entries: By 15th level, you are willing to sacrifice yourself before others. As an {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, you can choose up to 5 friendly creatures within 30 feet of you. For the next 3 turns, these creatures are {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB|immune} to all forms of damage, and the damage they receive instead goes to you. You can dismiss it anytime (no action required), and it ends early if you fall unconscious. You may use this feature once before a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Indestructible Defense
entries: At 20th level, you are able to resist any attack and become indestructible for a short period of time. At the start of your turn, you can use your {@variantrule Action|XPHB} to reduce your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} to 0 for the rest of the turn and become still in place, granting you {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to all damage and harmful effects until the start of your next turn. This feature can be instead used as a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to receiving damage or a harmful effect. If you do so, you become {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} and can't move until the end of your next turn. You may use this feature once before a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. However, you may use it extra times or extend the duration by another turn. For every extra use before a long rest, you gain 2 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels at the end of the effect.

subclassFeature.name: Master of All Shields
entries: {@i A Dungeon, an Ambush or a Last Stand. Your morphed shield prepares you for anything.}

These shielders often have finished harsh training on shield usage and can harness a magical or supernatural power to morph different shields to suit their necessities. These shielders usually come prepared for any situation and are either of great value to their party, or are often seen distant from the world.

subclassFeature.name: Shield Mastery
entries: When you decide on the Master of All Shields Path at 3rd level, your expertise with shields helps you block attacks more easily. {@filter Shields|items|type=shield=sand} you wear give an extra +1 bonus to {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB|AC}.
Additionally, large shields no longer give you a disadvantage on stealth checks, but tower and grand towers shields still do.

subclassFeature.name: Shield Morph
entries: Also at 3rd level, you can morph any shield you wear into a magical shield with special properties. Choose 3 {@filter Shield Morph Options|optionalfeatures|feature type=dla:sm} of your choice. As an {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, you can morph your shield into one of the selected shields. You can change your list of prepared shields whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Preventive Backup
entries: By 7th level, you become familiar with several shields, becoming prepared for unexpected situations with a backup shield. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can morph your shield into any of the {@filter Shield Morph Options|optionalfeatures|feature type=dla:sm} even if you don't have that option selected until you change your shield again or until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can only use this feature once before a long rest.
At 15th level, you may use it 2 times before resting. At 20th level, 3 times before a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Increased Armory
entries: By 15th level, you are able to prepare more shields to morph, expanding your armory and possibilities. Whenever you choose shields to prepare from your {@subclassFeature Shield Morph|Shielder|DLA|Master of All Shields|DLA|3} feature, you can now choose up to 5 shields to prepare instead of 3.

Additionally, whenever you prepare shields to morph, you can add one of the following Weapon Mastery Properties to your morphed shield: {@itemMastery Push|XPHB}, {@itemMastery Sap|XPHB}, or {@itemMastery Slow|XPHB}. At 20th level, you may add any weapon mastery to your morphed shield.

subclassFeature.name: Enhanced Armament
entries: At 20th level, you are able to unleash the full power of the shields you are able to morph. As an {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, you may use the {@b Enhanced Armament} ability of the shield you are currently using, which is detailed in your {@filter Shield Morph Options|optionalfeatures|feature type=dla:sm}. You may use this feature once before a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. However, you may use it extra times or extend the duration by another turn. For every extra use before a long rest, you gain 2 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels at the end of the effect.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Protector
entries: {@i Protect the weave, and the weave shall protect what you desire most}

These shielders might not be experts of close quarters combat, but excel at preparing spells both devastating and useful for many situations. They use their abilities to gain time to release the best spell for every situation.

subclassFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: When you decide on the Arcane Protector Path at 3rd level, you gain the ability to cast minor arcane spells, much like a wizard.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You know two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter Wizard|spells|level=0|class=wizard} spell list. Whenever you gain a Shielder level, you can replace one of this feature's cantrips with another cantrip of your choice from the Wizard spell list.
When you reach level 10 in this class, you learn another Wizard cantrip of your choice.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Arcane Protector Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of level 1 and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
entries: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose three level 1 spells from the {@filter Wizard|spells|level=1|class=wizard} spell list. {@spell Jump|XPHB}, {@spell Shield|XPHB}, and {@spell Sleep|XPHB} are recommended.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Shielder levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Arcane Protector Spellcasting table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional spells from the {@filter Wizard|spells|class=wizard} spell list until the number of spells on your list matches the number on the table. The chosen spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you're a level 7 Shielder, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of levels 1 and 2, in any combination.

entries.name: Changing your Prepared Spells
entries: Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one of the spells you know with another spell of your choice. The new spell must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your Arcane Protector spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an Arcane Focus or a {@filter Shield|items|type=shield=sand} as a {@filter Spellcasting Focus|items|type=spellcasting focus=sand} for the spells you prepare for this subclass.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Resistance
entries: Also at 3rd level, your physical resistance and training give you an edge on maintaining spells where other spellcasters can't. When you fail a {@status Concentration|XPHB} check, you may spend one of your {@classFeature Tough Resistance|Shielder|DLA|1} dice and add the result to the concentration check.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Armor
entries: By 7th level, you have learned to fluctuate the weave around you as a guard against other magical effects. Whenever you fail a saving throw against a spell or magical effect, you may use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and choose to succeed instead. You can only use this feature once before a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
At 15th level, you may use it 2 times before resting. At 20th level, 3 times before a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Magical Endurance
entries: By 15th level, you have mastered the arcane arts to bolster your defensive capabilities, gaining you and your allies more chance at surviving difficult situations. You may spend a spell slot to recover a number of your {@classFeature Tough Resistance|Shielder|DLA|1} die equal to the level of the spell slot used (up to a maximum equal to your Wisdom modifier; No action required).

subclassFeature.name: Spell Devourer
entries: At 20th level, you have learned the intricacies and complexity of magic, letting you absorb the weave around you and use it as a source of power and determination. As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell, you can interrupt the creature casting the spell, making its spell fail and have no effect. Alternatively, as an {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, choose one spell on a creature, object, or magical effect within range. The spell on the target ends.

Additionally, you recover {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to 5 times the level of the spell and you recover expended spell slots that have a combined level that is equal to or less than the level of the spell. For example, if the target is a 4th-level spell, you can recover up to four levels worth of spell slots. You can recover either two 2nd-level spell slots or four 1st-level spell slots. You may use this feature once before a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. However, you may use it extra times. For every extra use before a long rest, you gain 2 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels at the end of the effect.

subclassFeature.name: Guardian of Life
entries: {@i Staying alive is tough, but you are tougher}

All life is precious and must be valued, and protected. This is often the ideal behind many shielders who found their will in this path. They are no experts in healing, but they do know a thing or two about lessening injuries and keeping you alive.

entries.subclassFeature: Bond of the Martyr|Shielder|DLA|Guardian of Life|DLA|3

subclassFeature.name: Bond of the Martyr
entries: When you decide on the Guardian of Life Path at 3rd level, you've learned to connect with other creatures through pain, loss, and sacrifice. As an {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, you bind with up to a number of creatures within 30 feet of you that you can see equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. These creatures are bound to you for 1 minute, until they are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|hit points}, until they are farther than 60 feet from you, or until you dismiss it (no action required).

As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to seeing a bounded creature take damage, you can reduce that damage by half and the bounded creature gains {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the damage they received. Then, you take an amount of Force damage equal to the damage they took.

subclassFeature.name: Sudden Vitality
entries: Also at 3rd level, you know how to manage your vitality as well as the ones of those bound to you. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can use one of your {@classFeature Tough Resistance|Shielder|DLA|1} dice and recover {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the number rolled + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1).

Whenever one or more bounded creatures recover hit points through a spell or other magical effect, you recover a small amount of hit points; and when you recover hit points through a spell or other magical effect all creatures bound to you recover this amount as well. The amount to recover is equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Lifeline
entries: By 7th level, whenever a creature bound by you is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can use this feature (no action required) and the creature is dropped to 1 hit point instead. You are no longer bound to that creature. You can only use this feature once before a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
At 15th level, you may use it 2 times before resting. At 20th level, 3 times before a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Improved Bond
entries: By 15th level, the bonds you make are reinforced by trust, empathy and camaraderie. Bounded creatures can now be up to 120 feet away from you. Whenever you use your {@classFeature Tough Resistance|Shielder|DLA|1} dice for yourself, all bounded creatures gain a bonus to {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB|AC} and saving throws equal to half the number rolled (rounded up) until the start of your next turn.

Additionally, whenever you use your {@subclassFeature Bond of the Martyr|Shielder|DLA|Guardian of Life|DLA|3} reaction to reduce damage by half, you and all other bound creatures get {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} bonus + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 5).

subclassFeature.name: Sanctuary of Life
entries: At 20th level, there's no one else more capable of keeping your comrades safe, and none will perish while you stand. As an {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, you can bind to up to 6 creatures within 120 feet of you with your {@subclassFeature Bond of the Martyr|Shielder|DLA|Guardian of Life|DLA|3} feature. If any bounded creature is at 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, but not dead, they regain 1 hit point. Then, all bounded creatures gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points} equal to half their hit point maximum. You may use this feature once before a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. However, you may use it extra times. For every extra use before a long rest, you gain 2 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels at the end of the effect.

subclassFeature.name: Warden
entries: {@i The best defense is a fearsome offense}

Some shielders protect their allies with their shields, others do it through fear. Shielders who choose this path often use psionics, supernatural powers, or sometimes, their mere presence is enough to debilitate enemies and give their allies an advantage. After all, your enemies can't deal real damage if they are weak.

subclassFeature.name: Gatekeeper's Mark
entries: When you decide on the Warden Path at 3rd level, you gain the power to exhaust and debilitate those who run from you. Whenever you make an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB}, you may expend and roll one of your {@classFeature Tough Resistance|Shielder|DLA|1} dice to mark the creature until the end of their next turn. While marked, the creature has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on all attack rolls and ability checks. Additionally, whenever the creature is damaged, it takes extra Psychic damage equal to the roll.

subclassFeature.name: Overseer
entries: Also at 3rd level, you realize how important it is to always be on the lookout, always analyzing possible dangers. Whenever you are hit with a melee attack, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to gain one of your {@classFeature Tough Resistance|Shielder|DLA|1} dice.

Additionally, between turns you can use this feature to do a reaction even when you have already spent your reaction. Once you use this feature, you must finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} before you can use it again. Starting at 15th level, you can use it twice before a rest, but only once between your turns.

subclassFeature.name: Restraining Prison
entries: By 7th level, you can focus your energy to mentally lash into an enemy, leaving them paralyzed long enough to give your allies an opportunity to strike. Whenever a creature you can see starts its turn within 30 feet of you, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and force the creature to succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your {@classFeature Protective Focus|Shielder|DLA|1|Shielder DC}. On a failure, the creature is {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} until the start of its next turn. On a success, the use of this feature is not expended, but your reaction is. You can only use this feature once before a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
At 15th level, you may use it 2 times before resting. At 20th level, 3 times before a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Patrol of the Damned
entries: By 15th level, you've learned to infuse fear into the minds of creatures who try to oppose you. Marked creatures by your {@subclassFeature Gatekeeper's Mark|Shielder|DLA|Warden|DLA|3} feature are also {@condition Frightened|XPHB} of you. At the end of a marked creature's turn, you can expend a {@classFeature Tough Resistance|Shielder|DLA|1} dice to extend the mark until the end of their next turn (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Cursed Confinement
entries: At 20th level, your power can extend all around you, trapping those unfortunate enough to be near you. As an {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, choose any number of creatures within 30 feet of you. Those creatures are marked by your {@subclassFeature Gatekeeper's Mark|Shielder|DLA|Warden|DLA|3} feature and must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} until the start of your next turn. You may use this feature once before a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. However, you may use it extra times. For every extra use before a long rest, you gain 2 {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels at the end of the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Chain Shield
entries: Your shield transforms into a shield with an embedded 50 ft long metal chain. As an {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, you can extend or retract the chain embedded within your shield. Also as an action, you can try to grapple a creature with the chain of your shield. Make a ranged attack against a Large or smaller creature within 30 ft of you. If the attack hits, the creature is {@condition Grappled|XPHB}. At the start of each of its turns, the creature can do a saving throw against your {@classFeature Protective Focus|Shielder|DLA|1|Shielder DC} to break free. You can't use this ability if you already have a grappled creature. While grappling a creature, you may not move more than 30 feet away from it. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can pull the creature up to 30 ft straight towards you if it is of the same size or smaller than you, or you can pull yourself up to 30 ft straight to the target if its size is larger than yours.

entries.name: Enhanced Armament
entries: Your shield's chain extends and it's able to split to cover multiple targets. The chain's length becomes 300ft and you are able to try to grapple multiple creatures with it, independently of size. Make a range attack against up to 6 creatures (Huge creatures count as 3 and Gargantuan as 6). If the attack hits, the creature is grappled and follows the same rules as grappling a creature normally with your chain shield. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can pull or pull yourself towards a single creature of your choice. If that would put you more than 30 ft away from another grappled creature, the grappled creatures move enough to stay 30 ft from you.

optionalfeature.name: Thorn Shield
entries: Your shield is transformed into a green plant-like shield covered in thorns. Whenever a creature makes a melee attack on you and fails, that creature receives piercing damage equal to one of your {@classFeature Tough Resistance|Shielder|DLA|1} dice. As an {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, the ground in a 10-foot radius centered on a point within range twists and sprouts hard spikes and thorns. This space becomes {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. You can choose any number of creatures, and whenever another creature starts its turn or moves through this area, they take piercing damage equal to one of your Tough Resistance dice for each 5 ft it travels. The vines wither after an hour. You can use this feature again after a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Enhanced Armament
entries: Choose up to 6 creatures within 30 feet of you. They are affected by the {@spell Entangle|XPHB} spell. The DC for the spell is 20.
Additionally you can make the ground in a 30-foot radius centered on you twist and sprout hard spikes and thorns like those from your Thorn Shield.
Until you finish a long rest, the damage from your Thorn shield increases by {@dice 1d12}.

optionalfeature.name: Summoner Shield
entries: Your shield transforms into a shield with an embedded ancient summoning book. As an {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, you can summon a creature to be at your service. You can summon any creature that has a CR lower than . This CR limitation increases as you gain more levels in this class. The creature you summoned is friendly towards you and your allies, and it follows every command you give. The summoned creature takes its turn immediately after yours. This creature vanishes, leaving no physical form behind, when its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} reach 0 or after an hour. You may use this feature again after a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Enhanced Armament
entries: The summoning book in your shield overflows with power. You can summon any creature with a CR of 10 or lower, even if you have already summoned a creature. The creature still follows all other limitations of this shield.

optionalfeature.name: Mirror Shield
entries: Your shield transforms into a magical reflective mirror that allows you to create illusory reflections of yourself. As an {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, you create a perfect illusion of yourself that lasts for 10 minutes, until you use this feature again, or until you or the illusion receive damage. The illusion has your same {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB|AC}. The illusion appears in an unoccupied space that you can see within 30 feet of you. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on your turn, you can move the illusion up to 30 feet to a space you can see, but they must remain within 120 feet of you.

For the duration, you can cast spells and use your {@classFeature Mocking Taunt|Shielder|DLA|5} and {@classFeature Coverage|Shielder|DLA|9} features as though you were in the illusion's space, but you must use your own senses.

entries.name: Enhanced Armament
entries: You create 2 more illusions that last for 10 minutes or until you or the illusion takes damage. They appear in an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet of you. You and your copies then receive the effects of the {@spell Mirror Image|XPHB} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Storm Shield
entries: Your shield transforms into a cloud-shaped shield that appears darker and expels sparks of electricity as it accumulates damage. Each time someone attacks you but fails, you store a charge of static energy. You store 5 points of damage per miss, up to 30. As an {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, you can release all the absorbed damage into powerful lightning strikes. Choose a creature within 60 ft of you. Make a ranged spell attack against the target, Wisdom is your spellcasting ability modifier. If it hits, it deals damage equal to the absorbed damage and the target is shoved {@condition Prone|XPHB} 10ft backwards. When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, all absorbed damage resets.
Additionally, you gain a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB|walking speed}. You instantly descend to the ground if you finish your turn in the air.

entries.name: Enhanced Armament
entries: You create a powerful thunderstorm and a lighting bolt strikes where you stand charging completely your absorbed damage. Choose up to 6 creatures. Make a separate attack roll for each as you release lighting strikes to each of them. Until your next long rest, each missed attack gives you 5 more points of damage stored and your maximum damage you can absorb increases by 30.
Additionally, for an hour, your flying speed increases by 10 feet and you can hover while wearing this shield until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Ember Shield
entries: Your shield becomes decorated with flames and becomes a heat source. Your shield sheds bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light another 15 feet. You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to fire damage and your melee weapon attacks with your shield do an additional {@dice 1d6} fire damage. Once per {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can overheat your shield. For the next minute, or until you dismiss it (no action required), every creature within 15 feet of you receives {@dice 1d6} fire damage at the start of its turns and when entering this area for the first time.

entries.name: Enhanced Armament
entries: You overheat your shield to the point where you set objects and people ablaze. For 1 hour, you gain {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to fire damage. For a minute, or until you dismiss it (no action required), A wall of fire circles 30 feet around you. Creatures inside suffer from the {@spell Wall of Fire|XPHB} effects. Additionally, any creature wearing or holding metal items are affected by the {@spell Heat Metal|XPHB} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Frost Shield
entries: Your shield is covered in never melting ice. You can cast the {@spell Shape Water|XGE} cantrip. You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to cold damage and your melee weapon attacks with your shield do an additional {@dice 1d6} cold damage. You can create a non-magical wall of solid ice that is 30 feet wide and 10 feet tall. If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature within its area is pushed to one side of the wall and must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 3 of your {@classFeature Tough Resistance|Shielder|DLA|1} dice cold damage, or half as much damage on a successful save. The wall is an object that can be damaged and thus breached. It has {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB|AC} 12 and {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to 3 times your Shielder level, and it is {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB|vulnerable} to fire damage. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1).

entries.name: Enhanced Armament
entries: You absorb all heat surrounding you, using the cold to protect your allies. For 1 hour, you gain {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to cold damage. You and up to 6 creatures within 30 feet of you get the effects of a 6th level {@spell Armor of Agathys|XPHB}. Additionally, choose any other number of creatures within range and they must succeed a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or have their {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} reduced to 0 until the end of their next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Poison Shield
entries: Your shield is imbued with a mixture of dangerous poisons that come out of your shield. You gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to poison damage and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to being {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}. If you already have the poisoned condition, it is not neutralized but suppressed. Whenever you hit an attack with your shield you may try to poison the target. The target must succeed on a Constitution Saving Throw against your {@classFeature Protective Focus|Shielder|DLA|1|Shielder DC}. On a failure, choose one of the following:

items: {@b Obnoxious Venom:} The creature is poisoned for 1 minute. The creature may repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
{@b Viper's venom:} The creature receives poison damage equal to 3 of your {@classFeature Tough Resistance|Shielder|DLA|1} dice.
{@b Corroding Venom:} Until the end of its next turn, all attacks against the creature are made with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

entries: Additionally, any ally within 5ft of you may use their {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to coat a weapon or piece of ammunition with your poison. For 10 minutes, the next attack they do with the coated item gets the effect of your Poison Shield attacks.

entries.name: Enhanced Armament
entries: Your resistance to poison increases as your poison gets more potent. For an hour, you and allies within 30 ft of you have immunity to poison damage and the poisoned condition, as well as neutralizing any poison afflicting you.

Additionally, the DC of your shield's poison increases to 20, your shield's poison damage and poisoned condition ignore resistances, and if you choose the Corroding Venom option, the target is instead {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Lantern Shield
entries: The center of your shield shed bright light as if a bright lantern was in its place. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, your shield can shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light another 30 feet. In a 10-foot radius centered on you, you can even see in magical darkness and as an {@variantrule Action|XPHB} you can focus your sight and see illusions for what they are. As a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to being hit with a melee attack, you can cause the attacker to succeed on a Constitution saving throw against your {@classFeature Protective Focus|Shielder|DLA|1|Shielder DC} or be {@condition Blinded|XPHB} until the end of their next turn.

entries.name: Enhanced Armament
entries: You shed bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light another 30 feet. In this area, all magical darkness and illusions are dispelled, and you and your allies' weapon attacks do an extra {@dice 3d6} radiant damage.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Shield
entries: Your shield seems to now be cloaked in shadows extending all around you too. You and allies within 5 feet of you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, if you are standing in dim light or complete darkness, you can teleport up to 60 feet to another dim light or dark area you can see. Once per {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you may also cast {@spell Invisibility|XPHB} on yourself without spending a spell slot.

entries.name: Enhanced Armament
entries: You and up to 6 creatures gain the benefits of the Invisibility spell, except not even blindsight can see you. If you or those creatures attack while still in this Invisibility spell, you do a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Void Shield
entries: Your shield cracks showing a reek to an infinite abyss. As an {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, you can send a creature you can see within 30-feet of you to the void. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your {@classFeature Protective Focus|Shielder|DLA|1|Shielder DC} (the target can choose to fail); On a failure, you can send the creature to the void, a harmless demiplane, for up to 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns to end the effect on a success and return to a harmless unoccupied space near where it was. Alternatively, on a failure you may choose to teleport the target to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range. You may use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier. You regain expended uses after finishing a long rest.

entries.name: Enhanced Armament
entries: Choose any number of creatures within 30 feet of you. They must succeed on the Constitution saving throw or be sent to the void. The time limit is increased to 1 hour.

optionalfeature.name: Sacrificial Shield
entries: Your shield adopts an ominous appearance and aura, and feeds from your pain, blood, sorrow and tears. You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to necrotic damage and {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to effects that would reduce your maximum {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. Melee attacks with your shield deal additional bludgeoning or necrotic (your choice) damage based on the amount of missing hit points, as shown on the table below:

entries.name: Enhanced Armament
entries: You gain immunity to necrotic damage. You receive damage equal to half of your remaining hitpoints, charging your shield in the process. Make a melee attack roll with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} against a creature you can see within 30 feet of you. If it hits, you deal additional necrotic damage equal to the amount of hit points you are missing.

classFluff.name: Shielder
entries: Between the party of adventurers, returning from their last journey, stands a human amongst all of them. The bulky complexion of his clothes and the immense shield he drags with him serve as the party's best defense.

In front of the mighty red dragon stands a young dwarf. Holding a small shield, as cold as an ice dragon's breath. Challenging, she stands in front of the dragon, waiting for the lizard's next breath to use her best weapon, her shield.

A tiefling stands in front of the horde of skeletons, pushing them back. The tiefling resists hit after hit, holding the shield as strong as possible. After a while, the tiefling gets up, grins, pitifully, at the skeletons. The tiefling gained enough time to release a devastating spell.

Shielders sacrifice all of their offensive capabilities to gain enormous defensive ones, often supporting a party protecting them, or gaining enough time to strike the necessary blows or even to prepare the right spell. Being a shielder does not only mean being tough to take out but the desire to protect something, a place, your party, or even your own life.

entries.name: Defensive Specialists
entries: Shielders are not less than any other warrior. They sacrifice all their offensive capabilities to gain resistance to any type of attack and be able to protect anything. They spend their entire lives training the art of using a shield. They might use other weapons, but a shield will always be their top choice.

Opposed to any other shield-bearer, Shielders excel at being resistant, and able to make the most catastrophic attack into a kid's punch. Fighting in the front lines to protect their unit, or in the rearguard to gain time for their fellows, shielders support their party with protection. Where others see shields as extras, Shielders know that is all they need.

entries.name: Guardians
entries: Like any other being, Shielders often have something they want to protect, and if it is not their own lives, they would often risk themselves protecting it. They might guard a city, hidden treasure, an artifact, or those beloved to them. A shielder with nothing to protect is often a husk of a once-great defender, a rare sight, but not impossible.

To achieve their goals, it is common to see shielders being supported by individuals with higher offensive capabilities. However, some rare shielders might take their objectives without the help of anyone, isolating themselves from others. In any case, most shielders have the same goal; to guard and protect something important.

entries.name: Creating a Shielder
entries: Shielders exist to protect something. Think about what your character might be protecting. It can be as simple as protecting someone, or as complex as to be the protector of an idea or concept. Talk with your DM to determine what type of connection your character has with the protected. Dont forget to come up with the reason your character is protecting something; a traumatic event, a promise, a childhood experience, or even a strong personality are all reasons Shielders decide to be more defense-focused.

Shielders tend to have a really big moral compass and strong ideals. Discuss with your DM what personality might your character take, either following the idea of strong morale or taking a different approach with your character.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a shielder quickly by following these suggestions. First, put your highest ability score in Wisdom, followed by Strength. Second, choose the soldier background.

activation.condition: when you take damage and are Bloodied

entries: Using this on your Unarmed Strike or improvised weapon item will add Force damage as an additional selection when rolling damage.
Apply this to your Unarmed Strike or Pugilist Weapon.

activation.condition: When you use your Bloodied But Unbowed while you are Bloodied

entries: Pillar Breaker & Unmatched Athlete are not implemented.
The Advantage is only implemented if you have the Midi-QOL and Plutonium Automation Addon modules active.
